intro: Auganthus, commonly known as the African daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and thistles. The plants typically have showy, daisy-like flowers with bright yellow centers and white or pink petals. They are often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrive in full sun. Auganthus species are popular in gardens for their ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
